etymology.description: 羊肚 (sheep tripe) + 菌 (fungus) = a fungus whose cap resembles sheep tripe (morel).
etymology.interpretation: Highlights the honeycomb, wrinkled cap reminiscent of a sheep’s stomach lining. Common name for edible morels in Chinese.

parts.english: sheep tripe; sheep stomach; sheep belly; sheep offal

examples.chinese: 春天常见到羊肚菌在林地里生长(春天常見到羊肚菌在林地裡生長)。
examples.pinyin: Chūntiān cháng jiàn dào yángdǔjūn zài líndì lǐ shēngzhǎng.
examples.english: In spring, morels are often seen growing in woodlands.

examples.chinese: 它的菌盖像羊肚，因此得名(它的菌蓋像羊肚，因此得名)。
examples.pinyin: Tā de jūngài xiàng yángdǔ, yīncǐ démíng.
examples.english: Its cap looks like sheep tripe, hence the name.

examples.chinese: 羊肚菌味道鲜美，常被用来煲汤或炒菜(羊肚菌味道鮮美，常被用來煲湯或炒菜)。
examples.pinyin: Yángdǔjūn wèidào xiānměi, cháng bèi yònglái bāotāng huò chǎocài.
examples.english: Morels taste delicious and are often used in soups or stir-fries.
